message_1: Assume that you're using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 7 to encrypt your message. If your plaintext message is "MATHISFUN", what would be the corresponding ciphertext message?
message_2:
To encrypt the plaintext message "MATHISFUN" using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 7, we will shift each letter in the message 7 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter goes past "Z", it wraps around to the beginning of the alphabet.

M -> T (M + 7)
A -> H (A + 7)
T -> A (T + 7)
H -> O (H + 7)
I -> P (I + 7)
S -> Z (S + 7)
F -> M (F + 7)
U -> B (U + 7)
N -> U (N + 7)

The corresponding ciphertext message is "THOAPZMBU".
